revised_title: Male Butterfly Prehensores: Anatomy and Variations in Ornithoptera and Papilio Genera
tldr: The author examines the prehensile organs of male butterflies in the Ornithoptera and Papilio genera, providing detailed descriptions and illustrations of the valve, harpe, uncus, scaphium, and terms. These organs play a crucial role in the mating process, and their diverse forms and functions offer insights into the evolution and reproductive strategies of these species.
